alert.note: Alert for Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 8:26AM CDT until further notice by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Forecast flooding increased in duration for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River near Woodward affecting Woodward County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...North Canadian River near Woodward. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flooding of croplands... pastures... oil wells... and rural roads... extends along the river from the northwestern through the central and southeastern sections of Woodward County. Shallow depths may approach the edge of Woodward. Flooding affects areas near Fort Supply several hours before the crest reaches the Woodward vicinity and points downstream. Cattle and other property should be moved to locations 2 feet higher than nearby river banks to avoid being stranded for hours. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 5.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to 10.1 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall Tuesday evening. It will rise to 10.9 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 05/23/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 830 PM CDT.
